form.title: New Test Run
form.description: Configure and launch a new test run. Select the suites you want to run and configure the parameters.
form.urlDescription: The full URL of the endpoint you want to test or audit.
form.testSuitesDescription: Select one or more test suites to run against the target URL.
form.k6SwitchDescription: Simulate traffic to find performance bottlenecks.
form.lighthouseSwitchDescription: Audit for performance, accessibility, and more.
form.requestConfigDescription: Customize the HTTP request for your load test. (k6 only)
form.loadProfileDescription: Define the shape of the traffic for the load test.
form.customProfileDescription: Define a fixed number of VUs and duration, or create custom ramping stages.
form.stagesDescription: Define how the number of virtual users changes over time.

error.atLeastOne: You must select at least one test suite to run.

toast.historyClearedDescription: The previous test history has been cleared.
toast.testStartedDescription: Your test run is now in progress.

clearHistoryDialog.title: Clear Previous History?
clearHistoryDialog.description: You have previous test runs saved. Would you like to clear all local history before starting this new test? This action cannot be undone.

running.title: Test in Progress...
running.description: Please wait while the tests are being executed. This may take several minutes.

summary.title: Test Run Complete
summary.description: Below is the summary of the results for

history.title: Test History
history.description: Review, re-run, or export your past test runs. All data is stored locally.
history.noHistoryDescription: Run a test from the main page to see its results here.

toast.exportSuccessDescription: Your test history has been saved as a JSON file.
toast.importSuccessDescription: The test history has been successfully imported.
toast.importFailDescription: Could not import the history file.
toast.deleteSuccessDescription: The test run has been removed from your history.
toast.clearSuccessDescription: All test runs have been deleted.

clearAllDialog.title: Are you absolutely sure?
clearAllDialog.description: This will permanently delete your entire test history and recent URLs. This action cannot be undone.

deleteDialog.title: Delete this test run?
deleteDialog.description: This will permanently delete this test run from your local history.

about.title: About K6 Commander
about.description: K6 Commander is a lightweight, local-first, authorized load-testing platform designed for developers and performance engineers.
about.localFirstDescription: All test data and history are stored exclusively in your browser. No cloud account needed.
about.unifiedToolingDescription: One interface to run load tests, Lighthouse audits, and AI-powered SEO analysis.
about.k6FeatureDescription: Simulate traffic to find performance bottlenecks.
about.k6HowItWorks: When you run a load test, the application takes your UI configuration (VUs, stages, etc.) and passes them as environment variables to a k6 Docker container.
about.k6HowItWorks2: This container executes a flexible k6 script that sends metrics in real-time to an InfluxDB container. The live Grafana dashboard is pre-configured to query this database, giving you an immediate view of your test's performance.
about.lighthouseFeatureDescription: Audit for performance, accessibility, and more.
about.lighthouseHowItWorks: The backend spawns a system process using npx lighthouse, which programmatically runs a headless Google Chrome browser against your target URL.
about.lighthouseHowItWorks2: It generates a comprehensive report covering Performance, Accessibility, Best Practices, and SEO. The app parses the JSON output to show a summary and provides a link to the full, interactive HTML report.
about.seoHowItWorks: The backend fetches the raw HTML of the target URL. This content is then passed to a Genkit AI flow, which uses the Gemini model.
about.seoHowItWorks2: A specialized prompt instructs the AI to act as an expert SEO analyst, evaluating critical on-page elements, identifying issues, and generating actionable recommendations for improvement.
about.stackDescription: This project is built with modern, open-source technologies.
about.involvedDescription: This is an open-source project. Contributions are welcome!

steps.welcome: Welcome to K6 Commander! This is the main dashboard where you can launch new tests. Use this link to always return here.
steps.history: View your past test runs and results here. Everything is stored locally in your browser.
steps.about: Learn more about how K6 Commander works and the technologies it uses.
steps.github: Check out the source code, report issues, or contribute on GitHub.
steps.urlInput: Start by entering the full URL of the application you want to test.
steps.testSuites: Choose one or more test suites to run. You can run a load test, a Lighthouse audit, and an SEO analysis all at once.
steps.requestConfig: For load tests, you can customize the HTTP method, add headers, and include a request body if needed.
steps.loadProfile: Select a pre-defined load test shape or create your own custom profile with specific stages.
steps.runTest: Once you're ready, click here to launch the test. You'll be taken to a new view to monitor its progress.
